bug.short_desc: report "No enough disk space" instead of traceback

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: If the disk is full, dnf refuses to work due to corrupted metadata_lock.pid Although this is most probably correct behavior, it'd be nice if dnf did report the real root cause as an actual error message, not as a python back trace.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf --version 1.1.2 Installed: dnf-0:1.1.2-4.fc22.noarch at 2015-10-13 09:40 Built : Fedora Project at 2015-09-30 13:57
Installed: rpm-0:4.12.0.1-12.fc22.x86_64 at 2015-09-04 23:10 Built : Fedora Project at 2015-06-29 10:36
How reproducible: Every time if the disk is full
Steps to Reproduce: 1. fill up the disk 2. sudo dnf history 3.
Actual results: [user@machine ~]$ sudo dnf search virt-install [sudo] password for user: Malformed lock file found: /var/cache/dnf/metadata_lock.pid. Ensure no other dnf process is running and remove the lock file manually or run systemd-tmpfiles --remove dnf.conf.
[user@machine ~]$ sudo dnf history [sudo] password for user: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 883, in emit self.flush() File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 843, in flush self.stream.flush() IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device Logged from file logging.py, line 101 Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 883, in emit self.flush() File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 843, in flush self.stream.flush() IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device Logged from file logging.py, line 182 Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 883, in emit self.flush() File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 843, in flush self.stream.flush() IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device Logged from file cli.py, line 735 Malformed lock file found: /var/cache/dnf/metadata_lock.pid. Ensure no other dnf process is running and remove the lock file manually or run systemd-tmpfiles --remove dnf.conf.
Expected results: IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device
Additional info: This not issue only in DNF, i think it's bit of a "cultural" issue among programmers
